G3_build_succeeds.notes: `npm run build` completed successfully with static page generation.

G6_chart_library_installed.notes: `recharts` present in dependencies and used in matrix chart.

G9_chart_renders_data.notes: `StrategyMatrixChart` maps projects to scatter points via x/y fields and renders `<Scatter data={data}>`.

A1_data_population.evidence: 11 project files exist under `_content/projects` and are loaded in governance (`scripts/governance/index.mjs:42-99`).
A1_data_population.notes: Rich and coherent project dataset beyond minimum requirement.

A2_score_normalization.evidence: Normalization utility clamps then scales scores in `scripts/governance/index.mjs:22-25` and is applied in `scripts/governance/index.mjs:117-121`.
A2_score_normalization.notes: Correct transformation and separation from UI.

A3_quadrant_assignment.notes: Clean function and boundary handling; not externally configurable/tested.

A4_scatter_plot_rendering.evidence: Scatter chart uses fixed 0-100 axes and mapped data in `src/components/StrategyMatrixChart.tsx:54-74` and `src/components/StrategyMatrixChart.tsx:99-103`.
A4_scatter_plot_rendering.notes: Solid implementation with responsive container and labels.

A5_tooltip_implementation.evidence: Tooltip renders title, quadrant, ROI, and project link in `src/components/StrategyMatrixChart.tsx:75-97`.

A6_logic_ui_separation.evidence: Parsing, validation, normalization, and quadrant enrichment happen in governance scripts; chart consumes prepared matrix data (`scripts/governance/index.mjs:117-131`, `src/components/StrategyMatrixChart.tsx:31-41`).
A6_logic_ui_separation.notes: Strong architectural separation between transform and rendering layers.

A_strategy_matrix.category_commentary: Core matrix requirement is correctly implemented with strong data-pipeline separation and a clear chart implementation.

B1_project_setup.evidence: Project builds successfully with Next.js/TypeScript/Tailwind; scripts present in `package.json` and build verified via `npm run build`.
B1_project_setup.notes: Solid setup, though script coverage for lint/test is limited.

B2_routing_navigation.evidence: App routes include dashboard, matrix, roadmap, projects, updates and project detail (`src/app/...`). Sidebar nav and breadcrumbs implemented in `src/components/Sidebar.tsx` and `src/components/TopBar.tsx`.
B2_routing_navigation.notes: Comprehensive routing and shared layout navigation.

B3_type_safety.evidence: Typed domain models in `src/lib/types.ts`; runtime validation with Zod in `scripts/governance/schemas.mjs`.
B3_type_safety.notes: Good type discipline, though ingestion scripts are largely untyped JS.

B4_data_layer.evidence: Governance builds `public/master_data.json` from content (`scripts/governance/index.mjs:155-189`), then UI loads it through context (`src/context/DataContext.tsx`).

B_technical_foundation.category_commentary: Technical foundation is robust with clear content processing and route architecture.

C1_visual_design.evidence: Consistent card styles, gradients, typography, and iconography across pages (`src/app/*.tsx`, `src/components/*.tsx`).

C2_responsive_design.evidence: Mobile sidebar + overlay in `src/components/LayoutClient.tsx`, responsive containers/grids across pages.

C3_interactivity.evidence: Interactive filters, searchable modal, and hover states implemented (`src/app/projects/page.tsx`, `src/components/SearchModal.tsx`).
C3_interactivity.notes: Good level of interactivity with keyboard search support.

C4_empty_error_loading_states.evidence: Skeletons and fallback states implemented across dashboard, matrix, roadmap, and projects pages.
C4_empty_error_loading_states.notes: Good coverage of non-happy paths, though fetch-level error detail is minimal.

C5_design_token_usage.evidence: Config loading exists (`src/lib/config.ts`) and token injector exists, but many component colors are still hardcoded (`src/components/Sidebar.tsx`, `src/components/TopBar.tsx`).
C5_design_token_usage.notes: Token integration is partial rather than pervasive.

C_ui_ux_quality.category_commentary: UX quality is good overall, with strong interaction patterns, but design token usage is only partial.

D1_schema_adherence.evidence: Structured schema validation in `scripts/governance/schemas.mjs` and content validation in `scripts/governance/index.mjs:68-73`.
D1_schema_adherence.notes: Strong adherence with runtime checks in place.

D2_quadrant_logic_accuracy.evidence: Quadrants map correctly using impact>=50 and effort>=50 thresholds in `scripts/governance/index.mjs:27-34`.
D2_quadrant_logic_accuracy.notes: Matches required logic and axis orientation.

D3_route_structure.evidence: Route structure includes required matrix path and expected supporting pages (`src/app/matrix/page.tsx`, `src/app/projects/page.tsx`, etc.).
D3_route_structure.notes: Route coverage aligns with expected product structure.

D4_specification_details.evidence: Runbook scripts exist and function (`npm run governance`, `npm run ingestion`, `npm run staging:promote`), but candidate-provided instruction `npm run staging: promote` is syntactically incorrect and fails with missing script.
D4_specification_details.notes: Core feature implementation aligns well, but operational instruction quality has a notable mismatch.

D_prd_compliance.category_commentary: PRD implementation is largely compliant; main gap is command/runbook precision outside the core matrix.

E1_separation_of_concerns.evidence: Clear split between ingestion/governance scripts, typed app models, context loading, and presentational components.

E2_readability_naming.evidence: Consistent naming and clear component/function organization across `src` and `scripts`.

E3_error_handling.evidence: `DataContext` does not validate HTTP status before JSON parse (`src/context/DataContext.tsx:16-24`); update sort comparator never returns 0 for equal dates (`scripts/governance/index.mjs:151`).
E3_error_handling.notes: Basic error paths exist, but edge-case handling is inconsistent.

E4_dependency_choices.evidence: Dependencies are appropriate for scope (`recharts`, `gray-matter`, `zod`, `fuse.js`, `openai`), and build works with them.
E4_dependency_choices.notes: Good choices, though dependency versions include known deprecations/vulnerability notices during install.

E_code_quality.category_commentary: Codebase quality is good, but there are correctness and robustness gaps in error handling and some implementation details.

F1_dashboard.evidence: Dashboard metrics, phase indicator, velocity chart, and recent activity implemented (`src/app/page.tsx` + related components).

F2_additional_pages.evidence: Roadmap, updates, projects listing, and project details are all implemented.
F2_additional_pages.notes: Broad feature completion beyond must-have matrix.

F3_search_filtering.evidence: Fuse-based search modal with keyboard selection (`src/components/SearchModal.tsx`) and multi-filter project library (`src/app/projects/page.tsx`).

F4_creative_additions.evidence: Temporal status logic and ingestion pipeline are additional capabilities (`scripts/governance/index.mjs:101-114`, `scripts/ingestion/*`).
F4_creative_additions.notes: Useful creative extensions with clear product value.

F_bonus_features.category_commentary: Candidate delivered substantial bonus functionality with meaningful product additions.

G1_prioritization.evidence: Core matrix completed with multiple bonus features (search, roadmap, ingestion/governance pipeline).

G2_pr_description.evidence: No PR description or explicit submission summary artifact was found in the repository; README content is assignment/project documentation, not a candidate delivery summary.
G2_pr_description.notes: By rubric definition, this is a 0 when no PR/submission summary is present.

G_decision_making.category_commentary: Feature prioritization was solid, but formal delivery communication is missing per rubric.

H1_commit_cadence.evidence: 9 commits with incremental progression from base functionality to UI and workflow updates.
H1_commit_cadence.notes: Reasonable cadence for a timed assessment.

H2_message_quality.evidence: Some messages are descriptive, but several are generic (`UI Working`, `All Working`).

H3_logical_progression.evidence: Commits show a coherent progression: setup/features/polish/workflow fixes.

top_strengths: Implemented a strong governance pipeline that validates content and enriches matrix fields before UI render.
Completed all automated gate requirements, including matrix rendering and tooltip support.
Shipped meaningful bonus functionality: dashboard, searchable project library, roadmap views, and ingestion/promote scripts.
Maintained clean architectural separation between data logic and presentation components.
top_weaknesses: Operational instructions quality issue: candidate-provided command `npm run staging: promote` fails; correct command is `npm run staging:promote`.
`TopBar` breadcrumb navigation uses raw `<a href>` links (`src/components/TopBar.tsx:83-85`) instead of Next.js `Link`, causing full page reload navigation for breadcrumb clicks.
Error-path robustness is uneven (`src/context/DataContext.tsx:16-24` and update sorting comparator in `scripts/governance/index.mjs:151`).
Keyboard shortcut handling is Mac-only (`metaKey` only) in `src/components/TopBar.tsx:49`, reducing cross-platform UX.
No PR description or explicit submission summary was provided, which scores 0 on rubric criterion G2.
standout_moments: Governance preprocessing (validation + normalization + quadrant assignment) is a strong engineering choice for reliability and maintainability.
Ingestion pipeline is fully wired with normalization and staged promotion flow, not just stubbed.
qualitative_summary.hiring_signal: This candidate demonstrates strong product delivery ability and good architectural instincts, especially around precomputed data pipelines and UI breadth. The main risks are in edge-case correctness and operational precision, which showed up in runbook command accuracy and a few implementation bugs. Overall this is a solid engineering performance with moderate execution-quality gaps.
